body:
currently it's not possible to mount external storage on the root (afaik).
we should probably add validation to prevent people to put "/" or "\" as mount point.
i feel like if we'd allow it it might break many things as much of the code rely on the home storage being on the web server.

@morgen2009 i think the only way you could achieve what you want to reach is:
1. create a user "user1" (the user in question)
2. set the quota of "user1" to 0 to disallow uploading to the home
3. mount s3 in a subdir, for example "/s3"

the drawback is that the user will need to navigate into s3 every time. but if you use the sync client you could configure it to only sync "s3" instead of the root, thus making it transparent to you.

in the future we could maybe provide a "chroot" option in the user config.

cc @icewind1991
